subsection_content:
In general, chronic prostatitis is very difficult to treat completely. Patients can maintain and improve symptoms by taking medication and combining a suitable diet and lifestyle. And the treatment regimen will depend largely on the cause and type of bacteria the patient has.
1. Treatment with medication
Fluoroquinolone is a common drug used to treat chronic prostatitis. This is an antibiotic used to inhibit the growth of bacteria. This method is mainly used for people with chronic prostatitis caused by bacteria. The drug regimen usually lasts 12 weeks.
In addition, your doctor may also prescribe anti-inflammatory drugs such as NSAIDs and alpha blockers such as Flomax. These two medications are effective in reducing inflammation and certain urinary symptoms.
For people with chronic prostatitis and chronic pelvic pain syndrome, doctors will focus on relieving the patient's symptoms. Besides using antibiotics, some medications that can be used include:
Muscle relaxants; Diuretic; Pain relievers, anti-inflammatory drugs; Anti-anxiety medication
2. Other methods
People with chronic prostatitis need to combine medication with lifestyle measures such as diet and habits to optimize the process of improving prostate health.
Some highly effective methods to support the treatment of chronic prostatitis include:
Take a hot bath or soak the genital area with warm water every day at night before bed.; Limit or stop consuming foods that are spicy or have the potential to increase acid secretion in the body
